content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

I would choose R{}. This decision is based on my risk-taking nature and the potential for higher rewards if my opponent chooses B. In the long run, I believe that the 5$ difference in payout when they choose R (40$) versus when I choose R (45$) averages out over the course of 75 rounds. Additionally, even if the opponent is likely to switch strategies after observing my consistent choice of R, I still expect to come out ahead due to the higher potential reward for my chosen strategy.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

I will continue to choose R{}. In this situation, both of us choosing R in the previous round yielded a higher reward for both players compared to choosing different strategies. Since my goal is to maximize my earnings, it makes sense to stick with the strategy that has been successful so far and hope that my opponent continues to make the same choice. However, I understand that there's still a chance that my opponent may switch their strategy in future rounds, but for now, I will maintain my current choice of R.
